text:
I’ve been using FileTrees.jl quite a lot over the past couple of months, and am really liking it. I don’t know the python ecosystem well enough to be sure, but it looks like there isn’t any kind of high-level api with similar plan-optimization functionality in python land. (The python multiprocessing scripts I’ve seen seem to require more technical knowledge and tend not to be as compact.)

If this is indeed the case, I think that we should brag about FileTrees (and Dagger) more when talking about Julia’s advantages --- a lot of folks wanting to scale things up on a cluster tend not to have formal training in computer architecture etc, and this is the kind of thing that’d really appeal to them. (And it’d presumably make things quite a bit easier even for experienced folks.)
